TopicTitle: FusTek Parts [.20][Munox, Karmony Modules, Station Parts, Docking Nodes] [19.X]

Articles.Content:
Can anything be done about the yellow hand-holds? I saw a comment a while back about how they don't look realistic on the docking nodes, but nothing has been done. I'd like to use these parts, is there a way I can mod the yellow to a metallic look?

The textures should all be .png's you can edit yourselves. However, I'm super busy at the moment and I'd like to just get the new CBMs out.

If you're talking specifically about the karmony nodes, that is because of the crazy collider I had to build in order to get those recessed nodes along the cylinder. Thanks to convex colliders my hands are tied there and I have to do some pretty crazy stuff.

No worries then and thanks for the reply. Seems Unity is holding you guys back lol. Anyway I feel your pain as far as school goes. It seems to be never ending! Keep up the good work!
The only problem I have with the yellow handles is that the stock parts don't match them.

The only problem I have with the yellow handles is that the stock parts don't match them.

Meh. IMO, it doesn't matter; sometimes its neat to build something then sit back and realize just how many different things you used to build the structure with.
Can you upload a mirror version? Cause' spaceport is down
I'll put up a mirror tomorrow morning if space port is still down.
Fusty, I believe SpacePort is back up - no need for the mirror
Spaceport went back up about the same time .20 was released.
The connection nodes for both Karmony Nodes are off by a lot
Probably the same issue that's caused problems elsewhere, try adding scale=1 to the config file.

Good news everybody: Seems the 2.5m Common Berthing Mechanism is compatible with the Clamp-O-Tron Sr!

(Very good thing since i use the former almost everywhere)

Good news everybody: Seems the 2.5m Common Berthing Mechanism is compatible with the Clamp-O-Tron Sr!

(Very good thing since i use the former almost everywhere)

Actually, all CBMs are compatible with stock (and perhaps other mods') docking ports...

Actually, all CBMs are compatible with stock (and perhaps other mods') docking ports...

Haven't Tested this yet, about to fire up KSP right now.

I've updated all the downloads with proper Part Configs and the new folder structure. Upon Downloading just place the FusTek folder that is inside each zip into your KSP/GameData/ folder.

EDIT: Looks like RescaleFactor and a new Scale paramter are needed for some things. I'll notify you guys when everything is done.

EDIT2: Ok, everything seems to be fixed!

Edited May 23, 2013 by fusty
Thanks for putting the update together so quickly! Much appreciated.
Thanks Fusty!
Oh, the great re-downloading of mods, parts and do-hickeys has begun...

No prob, also fixed (hopefully) all the "breakintTorque" typos and changed them to "breakingTorque"

Otherwise, no significant changes.

Edit: It also seems they used the same size/naming convention for docking ports. So my 2.5m docking ports should hook right up to Squad's.

Yup, the ports dock beautifully.

Edited May 23, 2013 by fusty
Thanks for the prompt update!

I cant seem to get the parts to show up in-game. The list on the load screen, but no parts....the interiors/props do show up in the debug data list thought. I have Mechjeb 2.0.8.0, Crew Manifest, Protractor 2.4.1, the nazari cockpit, and some sphere fuel tanks loaded and all are working properly. I've got the FusTek mods installed the same way for all I can tell....no clue what Im doing wrong...

Please help, your mods are not only wonderful and look great...but are vital to my entire logistics chain in ksp!

well...not the Munox, but I need that to ferry cowards to the 'Sour-PussClub' orbital lockup....only heros on my missions =P

I did a new install of ksp when 0.20 hit...also im on windows 8

Are you sure you're placing the /FusTek/ folder into the /KSP/GameData/ folder? So there should be a Squad folder right next to a FusTek folder (along with your other mods).

It looks like the OX-Stat XL panel isn't quite right. It was missing scale=1, and it had Part { instead of PART {. The name = line has a typo (StaticPanlesXL), although that doesn't actually affect anything. I think the scale=1 was preventing it from showing up.

not sure what happened, had issue with another parts pack so did reinstall of ksp...now all is well =P

thanks for the speedy reply and doubly so on such a fast update...your mods are a must have imo...and now I have them again..*happydance*

It looks like the OX-Stat XL panel isn't quite right. It was missing scale=1, and it had Part { instead of PART {. The name = line has a typo (StaticPanlesXL), although that doesn't actually affect anything. I think the scale=1 was preventing it from showing up.

You must have caught the download before I realized how dumb I am. Redownload and you'll see that stuff has updated. scale = 1's and correct capitalization of PART are all fixed.
are the Karmonies compatible with .20?
